page.title: 04Famous Men of Halesowen
page.content:
Halesowen's most famous men include: **** William Shenstone 1714-1763 **** He was educated at Halesowen Grammar School and Pembroke College, Oxford. He wrote poetry and novels, but he is more famous for his landscape gardening. He dedicated his life and money to his estate, the Leasowes, beautifying its grounds. He rests in Halesowen Churchyard.
**** Thomas Attwood 1783-1856 **** He was the High Bailiff of Birmingham, promoter of the first Reform Bill, the founder of Political Unions and the first M.P. for the Borough of Birmingham. He was made a Freeman of the City of London.
